meta.title: Meta's Vision for AI and AR Integration

acronyms.full: Meta's open-source large language model family

purpose: Explore the future Meta is building, specifically the integration of AI and AR.
Understand the 10-year R&D effort culminating in full holographic AR glasses.
Discuss Meta's perspective on 'presence' as a core value.
Examine the challenges of social connection in the modern era.
Contrast Meta's open-source AI strategy (Llama) with closed models.

items: Completed 10 years of R&D on the 'first full holographic augmented reality glasses'.
Miniaturized components: micro projectors, wave guides with nano etchings, eye tracking, spatial sensors, onboard compute, batteries, and speakers.
Complex integration includes synchronizing dual-eye holograms, handling physical movement, and a wrist-based neural interface.
Core values pursued are 1) Presence (physical co-location feeling) and 2) Personalized AI (with real-world context).
Ray-Ban Meta glasses (display-less) will enable real-time translation.
AI strategy focuses on accelerating user content creation, enabling system-generated (personalized) content, and allowing creators to build AI 'artifacts'.
Advocates for an open-source AI (Llama) approach, arguing it is safer and more secure due to widespread scrutiny.

workstreams.name: Full Holographic AR Glasses
workstreams.notes: The 'ultimate product' and 'science fiction future'. Aims to be the next major computing platform.

workstreams.name: Display-less Glasses (Ray-Ban Meta)
workstreams.notes: Affordable tier focused on AI interaction (voice) and real-time translation.

workstreams.name: Heads-Up Display (HUD) Glasses
workstreams.notes: Middle-tier product with a smaller field of view (20-30Â°) optimized for reading AI outputs and notifications.

workstreams.name: Mixed Reality Headsets (Quest)
workstreams.notes: Will remain important as they can hold more compute and deliver high-resolution MR affordably.

workstreams.name: Haptics & Force Feedback
workstreams.notes: Considered the 'hardest thing.' Research is progressing, focusing on hands first.

workstreams.name: Llama AI Scaling
workstreams.notes: Scaling architectures from Llama 3 up to Llama 5, betting on continued advancement of Transformers.

overlaps: Shared industry interest (e.g., Apple Vision Pro, Meta Quest) in mixed reality and immersive computing.
Goal of achieving 'presence' is shared, though definitions may vary.

items: Commitment to an 'open-source-first' AI philosophy (Llama) in contrast to closed models.
Vision of AR glasses as the next 'social platform,' not just a productivity tool.
Structured three-tier product strategy (Display-less, HUD, Full Holographic) to cover different price points and use cases.
Belief that open source AI is fundamentally safer and more secure.

fast_track: Integrate Llama AI with AR devices to provide real-time, context-aware multimodal intelligence (vision, audio).
Enable practical AI features like real-time translation on wearable devices.
research_track: Continue R&D on haptics and force feedback to simulate realistic touch and presence.
Explore the scaling limits of current Transformer AI architectures (e.g., Llama 5).
Investigate how AI 'raises the bar' for human skills, strengthening cognitive 'muscles' rather than replacing them.

decisions.decision: Position full holographic AR glasses as the next major computing platform after phones.
Commit to an open-source AI strategy (Llama) to foster diversity, innovation, and security.
Approve large-scale investment ('hundreds of billions of dollars') based on the bet that current AI (Transformer) architectures will continue to scale.

risks_open.risk: Achieving realistic physical touch (haptics/force feedback) remains the 'hardest thing' and a major technical challenge.
risks_open.mitigation: Focusing R&D on hands first, which are the most important sensory area.

risks_open.risk: Unknown upper bounds (potential plateau) for scaling current Transformer AI architectures.
risks_open.mitigation: Investing heavily to test the scaling limits (e.g., Llama 3 to Llama 5).

risks_open.risk: Broad societal anxiety and uncertainty due to the rapid pace of AI-driven change and job relevance.
risks_open.mitigation: Encouraging curiosity and embracing technology to improve work, rather than fighting change.

risks_open.risk: Persistent decline in in-person socialization and social capital.
risks_open.mitigation: Belief that AR/presence tools will unlock *more* connection, arguing the decline has deeper roots than technology.

risks_open.risk: AI development may weaken human cognitive 'muscles' by removing beneficial struggles.
risks_open.mitigation: Belief that AI will 'raise the bar,' shifting human struggle to higher-level creative and editorial challenges.

actions.task: Deliver mid-tier affordable AR HUD glasses for mainstream consumers.
Advance research into force-feedback haptics for immersive realism.
Expand Llama AI open-source community and models.
Continue AI scaling and efficiency investigations on Transformer-based architectures (up to Llama 5).
